circumstances: Albert Russell, a 94-year-old male with a recognized disability, went missing from a pharmacy on West Clyde Street, Helensburgh. Before his disappearance, Albert mentioned to his friend, Eric, about attending a gathering at the community center located along Main Road, G84 0AH. Fellow attendees reported seeing Albert distractedly wandering near the cliffs behind the synagogue. Concerns were raised as his grandmother used to caution about his fascination with heights. Realizing Albert hadn't returned, Eric and another friend of Albert's volunteered to comb the nearby area. Despite their determined search near Belsyde Avenue, Glasgow, G15 6AR, Albert remained elusive. His extended absence prompted a public appeal until a vigilant community member discovered him disoriented on Bassett Avenue, Glasgow.

Albert's absence from this routine concerned his neighbor and colleagues. The police continued their search and eventually located Albert safe at an acquaintance's residence on Bassett Avenue. While the circumstances that led to his disappearance were deeply personal, the familiarity of his eventual location brought immediate relief to those who knew him.
